reasoning: Cryptorchidism (undescended testis) measured as prevalence in male population. Birth prevalence approximately 3-4%, declining to ~0.8-1% by age 1 year due to spontaneous descent. Global prevalence estimate of 1.5% (15,000 per 100,000 males) represents mid-range across developed and developing populations. Metric type is prevalence rather than incidence because this is a congenital condition with defined population prevalence.
